byline.original: By STEVEN GREENHOUSE and REED ABELSON

abstract: Wal-Mart will make substantial cuts to health care coverage for part-time workers and raise premiums for many full-time staff, citing rising costs; employees working less than 24 hours per week will have no coverage; move is seen as end to period in which company attempted to mollify critics of its benefits program.
snippet: Citing rising costs, Wal-Mart is substantially rolling back coverage for part-time workers and significantly raising premiums for many full-time staff.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Organization United for Respect at Walmart

lead_paragraph: Citing rising costs, Wal-Mart is substantially rolling back coverage for part-time workers and significantly raising premiums for many full-time staff.

headline.main: Wal-Mart Cuts Some Health Care Benefits
headline.print_headline: Wal-Mart Cuts Some Health Care Benefits
